data.title: CADENZA e
data.meta_description: "Jockey Club CADENZA e-Tools for Elder Care" (the Programme) in 2018. 香港賽馬會慈善信託基金於2018年撥款二千四百萬港元，推行「賽馬會流金頌護老有e道」計劃。
data.text:
The theme for the symposium was Gerontechnology. Gerontechnology is the study of technology and ageing with the aim of creating technological environment, including assistive technology and inclusive design, for innovative and independent living and social participation of older persons in good health, comfort and safety. Areas of application include housing, personal mobility and transportation, communication, health, work and recreation.

The symposium focused on the use of advanced technology in care of elderly people and supporting independent living. Both overseas and local experts were invited to speak at the Symposium. Overseas speakers included Dr. Takanori Shibata, the inventor of a seal robot named PARO that has documented psychological benefits of animal therapy for dementia patients and that has been certified by the U.S. Federal Drug Administration as a medical device. Local experts included The Chinese University of Hong Kong Pro-Vice-Chancellor and Professor of Automation and Computer-Aided Engineering Professor Xu Yangsheng, CADENZA Project Director Professor Jean Woo, Jockey Club Centre for Positive Ageing Director Professor Timothy Kwok as well as representatives from Innovations and Technology Commission, Hong Kong Housing Society, Hong Kong Polytechnic University School of Design and Shatin Hospital.
